body:
If you are having trouble seeing our Dashboard, there are a number of free browser apps that can help with color adjustments. We've outlined options for the three most popular browsers: Chrome, Firefox, and Safari. Keep in mind that AdRoll is not affiliated with any of these apps.

Color adjustments for

  • Chrome
  • Firefox
  • Safari

Chrome: Color Enhancer

Setup

1. Click "Color Enhancer" or copy and paste the link above.This is a link that takes you directly to the app in the Chrome Store. Make sure the link opened in your Chrome browser.

2. Click "Add to Chrome"

3. In the dialog that appears, click "Add"

4. Color Enhancer can be adjusted through the icon that appears in the top right corner of your browser.

Firefox: Colorblind Design

Setup

1. Click "Colorblind Design" or copy and paste the link above. This is a link that takes you directly to the app download page. Make sure you open the URL in your Firefox browser.

2. Click "Add to Firefox"

3. In the dialog that appears, confirm that you want to "Install Now".

4. When installation is complete, you should see a message confirming this.

5. To adjust your browser's color settings, go to Tools > Web Developer > Responsive Design View

Safari (Mac): Built In

If you use a Mac (and Safari as your browser), you have built in accessibility tools to help you adjust color contrast.

Setup

1. Pull up System Preferences.

2. Click "Accessibility."

3. Under the Vision section, you have a number of Display options to choose from. Selecting any of these options will adjust your screen so it is easier to view anything you have pulled up.
name: A Colorblind Accessible Dashboard
title: A Colorblind Accessible Dashboard
